title: BlitzAnalysiz()
content:
BlitzAnalysiz() Welcome to BitzAnalysiz(), a site about in-depth analysis of World of Tanks Blitz game statistics. Here you can find (data-backed) answers to questions like:
 “What is the most over-powered tank in the game?" “What is the most played tank in the game?" “How is players’ WR distributed over the tiers?".  Stats for the latest update	Highest performing tanks	Most played tanks	Total battles by players	Latest posts  Blitzanalysiz.com launched   Stats since update 6.0 added   Other great WoT Blitz sites  BlitzStars - Player statistics BlitzStars Tank Compare - Tank comparison tool Blitz Hangar - Tank knowledge base WoTinspector.com - Tank armor analysis, Replays, Map inspector and more

title: Career stats
content:
This page shows statistics of players’ battles fought during their Blitz “career” until the end of update 6.0.
Battles per Player Number of total battles per player in the end of the update 6.0. An average player has played 5769 battles by the end of update 6.0. Median battle count was 3240 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) was 134598 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update (i.e. “90% most inactive” == “10% most active”).
Battles per Player table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played until the end of 6.0 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip: 10% most active players have played more than the 90% most inactive players.

Average Tier The following graph shows a histogram of share of players (y-axis) average tier (x-axis). Only players with more than 500 battles during their Blitz “career” are included.
WR vs Average Tier This graph shows player Career WR vs. average tier until the end of update 6.0. Minimum 500 battles required.

title: Update 6.9
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.9. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.9. On average, players played 384 battles. Median was 236 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.9 was 7230 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.9 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 8   25% 50   50% 236   75% 562   90% 959   100% 7230      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.9 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Tier IX stats
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought at tier IX during update 6.0.
Battles per player Number of battles fought per player during the update 6.0.
On average, players played 95 battles. Median was 45 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.0 was 8286 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

Relative WR is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.9 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 5-30 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank are included Only players with 10-60 battles at the tier (tier depended) during the update are included. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR is the average WR of the players of the tank in all the other same tier tanks. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.8
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.8. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.8. On average, players played 365 battles. Median was 211 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.8 was 58804 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.8 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 8   25% 45   50% 211   75% 518   90% 900   100% 58804      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.8 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

Average Tier The following graph shows a histogram of share of players (y-axis) with certain average tier during the update 6.8 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 are included.
The large number of players who played only few battles during the update are clearly visible in the unfiltered average tier histogram.
More Statistics by Tier here.
Players by Region This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. More Statistics by region here. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.
 Tanks with the Highest WR This graph shows the tanks with the highest average WR during update 6.8. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested. More Tank Statistics here.

title: Blog
content:
Blitzanalysiz.com launched  Hy!
BlitzAnalysiz.com is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the player population and tank performance statistics.
 Stats since update 6.0 added  I have been busy cleaning up the codebase and fixing tons of little issues. Here are main updates: Stats since update 6.0 I have added stats for updates since 6.0 to the site.

title: Stats by tier
content:
This page shows player statistics per tier played during update 6.0. Tank statistics per tier can be found here.
Average tier WR vs average tier This graph shows player WR vs. average tier during the update 6.0. Minimum 100 battles required.
Share of players per WR per tier This chart shows share of players with certain WR (bar color-code) at certain tier (x-axis). Each players’ battles at different tiers have been taken into account as long as the player as at least 100 battles at a tier during the update.
Number of Battles per tier Share of battles per tank type per tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier with with particular tank type during update 6.0. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (85237844).
Share of battles per tank type per tier This chart shows share of battles fought at tier with with particular tank type during update 6.0. The width of the bar shows the share of battles in that tier’s tanks out of total number of battles in the dataset (85237844).

content:

title: Update 6.7
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.7. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.7. On average, players played 383 battles. Median was 232 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.7 was 32962 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

title: Tier VII Tanks
content:
Highest Average WR This graph shows the tanks with the highest average WR at tier VII during update 6.0. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR across all the tanks during the update. Only tanks with more than 50 players are listed. This may filter out few upcoming tanks that are being tested.
Highest Average WR - Table Average WR denotes average WR in a tank accross all the players during the update. Player WR denotes the tank’s players’ average WR accross all the tanks during the update.
  Show table      Tank Average WR Player WR Players Battles Vehicle Class Tank type     Edelweiss 62.0 56.1 3442 30866 Medium Tank Premium   Lupus 61.3 55.8 4163 46835 Heavy Tank Premium   Hafen 61.1 55.6 1297 8323 Medium Tank Premium   T28 Concept 61.0 54.2 6901 90470 Tank Destroyer Premium   Nameless 60.7 55.0 3460 28675 Heavy Tank Premium   Smasher 60.5 56.6 4996 364243 Heavy Tank Premium   T6 Dracula 60.3 57.2 11741 360927 Medium Tank Premium   IS-2 (1945) 58.7 54.8 9391 129385 Heavy Tank Premium   Type 62 58.5 56.9 14025 282947 Light Tank Premium   Helsing H0 58.5 56.0 11823 429078 Tank Destroyer Premium   Tankenstein 57.4 55.6 7280 90389 Heavy Tank Premium   Gravedigger 56.8 54.8 9799 172154 Heavy Tank Premium   WZ 135G FT Blaze 56.1 54.7 6528 84820 Tank Destroyer Premium   M6A2E1 55.9 53.2 12569 227050 Heavy Tank Premium   T-34-85 Rudy 55.9 55.1 15214 228879 Medium Tank Premium   VK 45.03 55.6 53.2 8599 106011 Heavy Tank Premium   T-34-1 55.4 52.2 10820 186274 Medium Tank Researchable   Vindicator Ultramarines 55.0 55.2 2736 48549 Tank Destroyer Premium   Tiger (P) 55.0 51.8 29761 736639 Heavy Tank Researchable   Black Prince 54.9 51.8 11070 223540 Heavy Tank Researchable      Highest Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest Relative WR - that is the average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR with tier other same tier tanks. Relative WR is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 5-30 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank are included Only players with 10-60 battles at the tier (tier depended) during the update are included. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR is the average WR of the players of the tank in all the other same tier tanks. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.3 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 5-30 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank are included Only players with 10-60 battles at the tier (tier depended) during the update are included. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR is the average WR of the players of the tank in all the other same tier tanks. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks.   Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.7 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 5-30 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank are included Only players with 10-60 battles at the tier (tier depended) during the update are included. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR is the average WR of the players of the tank in all the other same tier tanks. title: Update 6.6
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.6. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.6. On average, players played 400 battles. Median was 260 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.6 was 62161 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.6 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Update 6.5
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.5. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.5. On average, players played 279 battles. Median was 161 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.5 was 45570 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.5 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 7   25% 36   50% 161   75% 389   90% 674   100% 45570      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.5 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Update 6.4
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.4. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.4. On average, players played 327 battles. Median was 184 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.4 was 77459 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.4 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 7   25% 40   50% 184   75% 456   90% 797   100% 77459      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.4 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

Average Tier The following graph shows a histogram of share of players (y-axis) with certain average tier during the update 6.4 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 are included.
The large number of players who played only few battles during the update are clearly visible in the unfiltered average tier histogram.
More Statistics by Tier here.
Players by Region This graphs shows players by region in the dataset who have played at least one game. More Statistics by region here. Please note, this does not mean all the players per server, but just those who have been recorded in the BlitzAnalysiz database.

D 53.0 53.3 9660 93065 Medium Tank Researchable   Valentine II 52.8 53.9 3071 16861 Light Tank Premium   Matilda 52.8 53.4 14173 134608 Heavy Tank Researchable      Highest Relative WR The graph shows tanks with the highest Relative WR - that is the average of players’ WR in the tank compared to the players’ WR with tier other same tier tanks. Relative WR is a measure of the performance of the tank.
  Show details    All the statistics are about battles fought during the update 6.0 only. The impact of “Stock-grind battles” is reduced based on tier-specific requirement for total battles at the end of the update. Only players with more than 5-30 (depending on the tier) battles in a tank are included Only players with 10-60 battles at the tier (tier depended) during the update are included. Average WR is the players’s average WR in the tank Player WR is the average WR of the players of the tank in all the other same tier tanks. Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.3
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.3. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.3. On average, players played 302 battles. Median was 179 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.3 was 40345 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.

title: Update 6.2
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.2. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.2. On average, players played 450 battles. Median was 242 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.2 was 91615 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.2 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.
  Show table      % of Players Battles during the update     10% 9   25% 55   50% 242   75% 572   90% 1001   100% 91615      Player WR Distribution The graph shows WR distribution for players (y-axis) with during the update 6.2 (x-axis). Only players with more than 100 battles are included.
From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
content:
1. Where is the data from All the data has been collected from WG API, stored in a database and processed with R/RStudio.
2. Are your numbers correct? Is there bias in the numbers? The statistics have been calculated from a data set with very high number of players (600,000+) and battles (in total 6bn+). That is maybe 4 times the data Blitzstars.com has, but there is still sampling bias as there is in Blitzstars’ numbers. This is evidenced by the overall WR distribution and the share of all wins out of all the battles in the database being above 50%. This is a topic worth of a longer post - stay tuned.
3. Why did you make the site? Out of pure interest into analysizing Blitz game statistics and to learn data analysis and R.
4. What is “Relative WR”? Relative WR the average WR players achieve with the tank compared to their other same tier tanks. If the tank is perfectly balanced, its Relative WR is 0 %. Large positive Relative WR indicates the tank is “very good” (read “OP”). Negative Relative WR indicate the tank performce worse than other same tier tanks. Relative WR is the 2nd best measure of tank’s performance, IMHO.
  Relative WR R code   rWR = Relative WR
stats.data.table[, WR.tier := sum(all.wins)/battles.tier, by=.(account_id, tier)]; stats.data.table[, tanks.tier := .N, by=.(account_id, tier)]; stats.data.table[ tanks.tier > 1, rWR := WR - (battles.tier*WR.tier - all.wins)/(battles.tier - all.battles)]; The bit cryptic syntax is R’s data.table - one of the fastest software packages for data analysis.
  5. Is BlitzAnalysiz()’ Relative WR different from Blitzstars’ one? Yes. At the moment Blitzstars.com calculate the Relative WR as WR difference to the players’ average WR over all their tanks. BlitzAnalysiz() considers only the other same tier tanks. Please note that the tank itself is excluded of the average WR in BlitzAnalysiz()’ calculations, but included in BlitzStars’ calculations. This may extra cause bias with hugely popular tanks.
6. I spotted a mistake or I have a question/request All the feedback on the site is welcome. You can reach out me via email (Jylpah@gmail.com), Discord (Jylpah#4662). I am also active at WoT Blitz EU forums.

Since different tiers have different difficulty, it is more meaningful to compare players’ performance in the same tier tanks. title: Update 6.0
content:
This page list statistics of battles fought during 6.0. All the stats (WR, damage, battles, etc.) refer to stats during the update, not cumululative/total/lifetime stats unless otherwise mentioned.
Battles per Player The graph shows the number of battles fought per player during the update 6.0. On average, players played 416 battles. Median was 257 and the largest number of battles recorded by a single player (in the dataset) during the update 6.0 was 34839 battles. The following tables shows battle counts by N% most inactive players during the update.
Battles per Player - Table The table below shows the (max) number of battles played during 6.0 by the X% most inactive players. Reading tip 10% most active players played more than the 90% most inactive players.

From the unfiltered WR histogram one can see the bumbs at 0%, 25%, 33%, 50%, 67% 75% and 100% due to large number of of players who played only few battles during the update.

title: About
content:
BlitzAnalysiz() is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz WWII-themed multiplayer tank game. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the overall player population and tank performance statistics.
The statistics shown at the site are based on maybe the largest collection of Blitz player stats outside Wargaming’s servers containing over 100 million individual tank statistics from more than 600,000 players from EU, RU, Asia and North American servers.
All the data has been fetched via WG’s API, stored in a database and processed in RStudio. The web site has been build with Hugo.
Big thanks for BlitzStars.com‘s developer SockRobber and WotInspector.com‘s developer reven86 for all the support!
BlitzAnalysiz() is build by Jylpah@EU. You can reach out me via email (Jylpah@gmail.com), Discord (Jylpah#4662). I am also active at WoT Blitz EU forums.

title: Stats since update 6.0 added
content:
I have been busy cleaning up the codebase and fixing tons of little issues. Here are main updates:
Stats since update 6.0 I have added stats for updates since 6.0 to the site. Please note that while certain graphs like WR vs. Battles played - update 6.0 show big differences between 6.0 and 6.9, the changes in the underlying game statistics are likely less, but are caused just BlitzAnalysiz() colleting data more players and especially more new/less active players.
Update 6.0 Update 6.9 Graph templates Now the code is much more manageable weith new graph templates. Previously each graph was a copy-paste from the previous similar one (and with little changes along the line) making it hard to manage the code as I discovered issues and fixed bugs. I can now add a new graph (as long as I have a template for the graph type), just with few lines of code like this:
res <- head(stats.update[DT_filter_battles_tank(all.battles, all.battles.new, tier, is_premium), .('Average WR' = mean(WR), 'Player WR' = mean(WR.global), 'Players' = uniqueN(account_id), 'Battles' = sum(all.battles), 'Premium' = first(is_premium)), by=name ][Players >= min_players][ order(-`Average WR`)],n=topN); res <- prep_plot_tank(res,'Average WR') title = get_plot_title_top_tanks('Average WR', topN = 20) plot_col_discrete_2Y(res,title, 'Tank', 'Average WR', 'Player WR', fill_var = 'Tank type')    ...instead of this:   res <- head(stats.update[, .('Avg. WR' = mean(WR), 'Player WR' = mean(WR.global), Players=uniqueN(account_id), Battles = sum(all.battles), Premium= unique(is_premium)), by=name ][Players >= min_players][ order(-`Avg. WR`)],n=topN); setnames(res, 'name', 'Tank'); res[, `Avg. WR`:=`Avg. WR` * 100]; res[, `Player WR`:=`Player WR` * 100]; res[Premium==TRUE, `Tank type`:='Premium'] res[Premium==FALSE, `Tank type`:= 'Researchable'] res[,`Tank type` := as.factor(`Tank type`)] res[,Premium := NULL] setcolorder(res,c('Tank', 'Avg. WR','Player WR', 'Players', 'Battles', 'Tank type')); ggplot(res) + aes(x = reorder(Tank, `Avg. WR`, (function (x) -x)), y = `Avg. WR`, fill= `Tank type`) + geom_col(aes(group=`Tank type`)) + scale_fill_manual('Tank type', values = c('Premium'='black', 'Researchable' = 'grey')) + geom_point(aes(x = reorder(Tank, `Avg. WR`, (function (x) -x)), y=`Player WR`, color = color.2nd_series, shape='Player WR'), shape='-', size=20, inherit.aes = FALSE) + scale_color_identity(name = NULL, guide='legend', labels= 'Player WR') + scale_x_discrete('Tank') + scale_y_continuous('Win rate', labels = div_format(seq(0,100,5),1,'%'), breaks = seq(0, 100, 5)) + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = 'white'), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5), panel.grid.minor = element_line(colour="grey", size=0.5), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 1), legend.key = element_blank()) + ggtitle(paste('TOP',topN, 'Tanks by WR'), subtitle = paste("Update",update));    In addition for the graph templates makin me happier, those ensure more consistent look and feel and allow me to easily add new graphs - there is never enough of those, right?
Unfiltered graphs For couple of gprahs I have added unfiltrered (i.e. all players) versions of those. Blitz has huge number of players who just play few games during the whole update. More than 10% of the players play less than e-i-g-h-t (8) battles during an update. And only small share of those players are ever looked at BlitzStars or happen to be recorded into replays sent to WoTinspector.com, therefore never ending up into Blitzanalysiz.com account database. For this reason I filter players based on minimun battle count requirement for many of the graphs. Otherwise the graphs would show players with 100% WR where in fact they had only one (lucky) game during the whole update.

title: Blitzanalysiz.com launched
content:
Hy!
BlitzAnalysiz.com is a site about in-depth game statistics of Wargaming’s World of Tanks Blitz. You won’t find individial player statistics here - for those, please check awesome Blitzstars.com. Instead, the the site is about analysis of the player population and tank performance statistics.
The statistics shown at the site are based on maybe the largest collection of Blitz player stats outside Wargaming’s servers containing over 100 million individual tank statistics from more than 600,000 players from EU, RU, Asia and North American servers.
BlitzAnalysiz() is build by Jylpah@EU. You can reach out me via email (Jylpah@gmail.com), Discord (Jylpah#4662). I am also active at WoT Blitz EU forums.
